p.p: This means that [mathjaxinline]\displaystyle \sum _{i=1}^ k \langle v, w_ i\rangle w_ i[/mathjaxinline] is

optioninput.options: ('an inner product of','a scalar multiple of','a linear combination of','a linear transformation of','a matrix whose columns are')
('v','one of the vectors w_i','the collection of vectors w_1...w_k')
('a scalar','a vector in W','a vector in V but not necessarily in W','a matrix','none of these')

font.p: Each [mathjaxinline]\langle v, w_ i\rangle w_ i[/mathjaxinline] is a scalar times a vector [mathjaxinline]w_ i[/mathjaxinline]. When we take the sum of these, it is (by definition) a linear combination of [mathjaxinline]\{ w_1; w_2; \ldots w_ k\}[/mathjaxinline], and thus is a vector. Specifically, it is a vector in [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline], since all the [mathjaxinline]w_ i[/mathjaxinline] are in [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline].
